First off I am not one for hate reviews. But I have never wanted to rid of a character's existence before, not even in School Days, until now.
Okay, so this is a sequel to Ef: a tale of memories. Which I found pleasant; sure it was a bit forceful with the emotions at times, but all in all at the end of the emotional roller coaster I felt satisfied. But Ef: a tale of melodies was way too pushy and on top of that had one character in particular who wouldn't just shut his mouth. It's like they want me to feel bad for somearrogant, deprived, indecisive, (I can't think of another word) ass-HOLE. He's constantly whining and talking about how "everyone is wearing a mask". Good grief, it's like he's an over dramatic 15 year old girl. Oh wait, he's in his twenties....And because of him being so unfortunate he disregards everyone who cares for him and out of his self loathing somehow manages to steal a poor high school girl's heart. It made me sick. I wished for his death so many times while watching this anime.\n\n
Other than that douche and his disgusting tale of "I want to die, no wait I want to live, please pay attention to me." There was another tale in the series that did touch my heart like its prequel. I'm glad I got to witness that story even if it did leave me a tad unfulfilled. However that ignoramus really ruined the entire experience for me. There, hate review done.

Finally got to watch this after catching up on other animes and this one is a good one and a must see.
The main story in my opinion is mostly renji-kun life, they had other small stories for everyone else, but most of it i believe leans more to renji. Renji always walks down a railroad track which has been broken for a long time, he meets a girl name Chihiro Shindou while he is walking. they start to talk alot and get to know each other, he has been warned not to fall in love with her and if he does, he will have toface what happens afterwards. Renji finds out that chihiro has a memory of a 13 hour life span, she can only remember 13 hours of her life, she always brings a diary with her and writes everything down so when she wakes up in the morning, she knows what she did they day before. Renji falls in love with her despite the fact of her condition and helps her with a dream she always wanted to do but was nearly impossible because of her condition, which is to write a novel. Anything else i say will basically be spoilers but for some reason i believe the main character in the short stories they have in this anime, renji would be the most important one.


The art in this anime is beautiful. you have your summer Christmas in a different country, then your winter Christmas in japan. Not only that this anime is all about art, the characters in the anime love to draw, one is a manga artist for example, so seeing all the art and pictures they make themselves is very good.


This is an overall good anime, you'll need to watch this first before watching ef a tale of melodies, so please watch memories first then melodies, but dont forget to bring something to wipe your tears with after watching this anime, this anime is all about love and romance and how far someone will go to be with someone they fell in love with.

I have to say i'm not with the mass majority on this one. Everyone who recommended Ef to me said it fantastic and that the second season was better and more emotional. After watching Ef - a tale of memories I got exited and couldn't wait to watch it. But I have to say I don't feel the same about this one. I just felt let down after watching the first season. The first season made me love all the characters and made me feel thing I've never felt before. I even cried but this time around i felt nothing. I have to say Ijust didn't feel it this time around. It was good but after watching the first season I just feel let down.


Now don't get me wrong now it was a good story. Think about this, I felt "Ef - a tale of melodies" was like "The Dark Knight Rises" its good and perfect it its own ways with miner flaws, and amazing as a stand alone but "Ef - a tale of memories" was "The Dark Night". Just mind blowing, amazing and makes it hard to live up to and that's how I feel about "Melodies" its good but not as good.


It was kinda confusing to keep up with the story. Having to go back and forth trying to tell the two stories. Yuuko and Yuu story taking place in the past while Mizuki and Shuuichi took place in the present after the events in the first season. There was a balance in stories this time around with both relationships having to deal with their own problems dealing with betrayal and death. A lot of death this time around. It was hard picking my favorite from these two stories because there stories were strong but at the same time they weren't really that good. Unlike in "Ef - a tale of memories" which mines was, and I think everyone's else's favorite was Chihiro and Renji. But this time around I'm not really sure which one l like the most. 


But toward the end I felt like I was dragging my feet to watch the rest. I got bored of this anime, when I was around episode 9 or 10 I felt like giving up but I'm not that kinda person so I finished it. I was expecting to cry even more this time around but nope not even one tear. To be honest I was getting kinda annoyed by everything toward the end. But I'm glad the ending was good. There were things about the ending I kinda hated but I wont write it down because of spoilers. If you want to know message me and ill tell you what was wrong with it. 


Don't forget to hit that "Helpful button" if you found this helpful in any way so others can find this review. Don't be afraid to send me a message if you want to talk more about this anime or had any comments with my review. ^_^

I actually found this anime 2 years ago but at that time i wasn't really interested in anime of this genre so i didnt watch past episode 1. When i found it again i had already decided that the most emotional and moving anime would be Clannad and Angel Beats! therefore i didn't expect much. Thinking back i feel like laughing at myself.
Before i begin my review i have to apologize if my review contains any form of spoilers although i will try to minimize them.
Story: I really liked this anime for its extremely deep and moving storyline. Besides this i also liked how itwas able to swing back and forth from the past to the present and back to the past. Even more than that it seemed as if switching from the past and present times helped to fill up the missing parts. I also liked how this anime shows how tragic incidents can affect people and invokes a lot of thinking on various subjects such as " is it better to die with your loved ones or live knowing that you left them to die". Besides that, this anime also shows you a little on how harsh the world can be at times but at the same time it also shows you that there are people who will be there for you even if its just 1.


Art: I really liked the art as it made the whole anime feel so real, as if you were watching the events in the anime happen in reality. I also have to say that the designs were great and the background and other effects were really magnificent.


Sound: Here we find a slight flaw in the anime. While i have no complaints with the soundtracks i sort of prefer those in the previous ef series with the exception of the opening - Ebullient Future - which i liked alot. But either way the timing for every sound effects were well done and the music complimented each scene quite well.


Character: Ahh the part i was looking forward to typing about the most. I really love the characters here from the naive young Himura and his kind but indirect older self, Kuze who seems like such a nice and easygoing person while harbouring a great burden and so on. The characters all have their own burdens to deal with although eventually they are finally able to resolve them. An interesting fact to point out is that with the exclusion of Akane, Nagi and Akira, the characters are all the same as the 1st season except this time the main characters of the 1st ef series now become supporting characters while supporting characters now become the main characters, with the exception of Emi. 


Enjoyment: Hmm truth to be told. You probably wouldn't find yourself absorbed into it until you watched a few episodes. You may even need to rewatch the series to get attached to it. However, once you get pulled in you can't ever get out.  A good tip for those who aren't patient is to watch this anime when you're bored or when you have alot of free time which you have no idea how to waste.


Overall: You would probably need a little patience with this anime but you would definitely love it if you give it a chance and watch every episode to the end. you would definitely find it worth your while.

This series is often compared to Clannad, and I can see why. They are both about love, tragedy and little miracles that can happen amongst all that. 
But I have to say, Ef, while a great anime in itself... Falls short. The series is made up of 12 episodes, the first season also 12. But I will talk about Melodies now, though many of the problems in Melodies, Memories also suffers from. 
So the series is made up of 12 episodes. That is fair. Some of my favourite anime only have 12 episodes, and normally I would call that a strength of sorts. With Efit couldn't be further from the truth. Ef focuses on more than one story, jumping from story to story, giving none the screen time to really bloom. It feels like most of the time each couple is given is for little more than furthering the plot, little of which is for the audience to connect with the characters. Making the whole mess feel forced and sometimes quite cold. There are points while watching where something tragic will be revealed or happen, and you will be left staring at the screen knowing this is meant to make you feel something... But instead you feel nothing, because not enough time has been given to really make you feel for them. And the end result is that it feels pushed in your face, out of place or worse it just takes you out of the anime all together. 

Of course by the end episode or so the characters have all had just ENOUGH development time that you finally start to feel something more than shock when something happens... But that is just too late by then, the damage has been done, and it can't be repaired.  


Ef would have been better as either a longer series, aka more episodes to each season... Or to focus more or soley on one story per season.


Ef is still a good anime however... And I recommend it a watch.

I laughed. I smiled. I cried. I rejoiced. I haven't felt like this before since Clannad. 
Ef - A tale of melodies is the perfect example of what happens you combine masterful artistic visuals to great storytelling. I felt like I was within the story instead of just watching it, that the character's pains were my pains, and their happiness, my happiness. 
Story - 9 The story's this good simply because nothing's rushed. Sure, maybe some of the romance between Mizuki and Kuze were a bit quick paced (and that's the only reason why this didn't get a 10!), but my gosh, every event unfoldedat the perfect time, almost like a fairytale. What's more, is the way the series portrays the ties between each character's philosophical perspectives, and the events that occurred to them to cause them to think in such a way. And finally, how each perspective changes, and ultimately, how they triumph over their individual troubles. It's a rewarding experience, watching them from start to finish, and you'll find yourself undoubtedly growing alongside them. This is an anime that will make you question, and think.  


Art & Sound - 10 Art and sound were both wonderful. Melodies like "A moon filled night" will definitely be going onto my top list alongside others like "Tabi no Tochuu" and "Palm of a tiny hand"


Character - 9 Although character development was sometimes a bit rushed, given the fact that this was a 12 episode series, and the way that it all came together in the end really made these little hiccups hard to notice in the grand scheme of things. 


Overall, Ef - A tale of melodies is one of those rare animes that will leave you awestruck with its brilliant storytelling and its inspiring messages. It's definitely inspired me to new heights, and I bet it'll inspire you too. 


If you haven't watched it yet, don't sleep tonight until you have :)

This anime is one of the most spellbinding. I was hooked from the first series and first episode. This series did not disappoint. 
As a follow on from last series  this series focuses on two different romances, a musician and a student and the friends that should have been. 
The art style is amazing but does drop a once in a while, the sound track is fantastic and over all I cried enough to fill a bathtub. This story will take you to hell and back. I had to pause it a few times before I could carry on watching. 
You'll carry on watchingthis because its just so compelling.

Story- 7
Art- 8
Sound- 9
Character- 9
Enjoyment- 9
____________
Overall- 9
Since this was only 12 episodes the story didn't really have enough time to develope and the creators had to rush it, but the story was still explained in a quick and understandable way. The story is basically about the main character who has been friends with a girl since childhood who was later on taken way from him and they later on met up again back in high school (story cut short so I don't have to spoil it).
The art is just as others have mentioned, its like a person's painting coming to life, which is pretty uniquebut wasn't my taste. The characters were well drawn but there were some minor flaws. The background was also drawn good too.\n
The sound was pretty good, the opening theme was nice and so was the music they played throughout the show. The violin that was played in this was perfect. When you listen to it you sorta feel as if your in an opera room.\n
The characters in this show were actually developed pretty good with the lack of episodes they had. Each of them having their special personality and also their own problems. The characters were one thing that stuck out in this anime.\n
Overall I dislike short animes that have only 12 episodes but I did really enjoy this one. There was a mixture of emotions in this and it will have it's twists and turns but I do recommend this to people who are looking for Romance and Drama.

Story: This really is something else than your normal romance / drama series (not in the sense of school days). Of course, if you've seen the first series (tale of memories), you'll already know the gist of whats going to happen. A hefty sum of twists and turns to keep you watching throughout the whole 13 episodes.
Art: Once again, something different (in some aspects). Different style of graphics to make the art in this stunning.
Sound: Tenmon. Same music makers as Place Promised in Our Early Days and 5 Centemeters Per Second. Fantastic use of violins and and some brass to make it very smooth andcalm to rough and violent.


Character: Very believable. What people say, their reactions, and the space between talks is similar to how reality would be like.


Enjoyment: Great. To me, I enjoyed it very much. Most certainly wouldn't mind watching it again.


Overall: I would have rated it 10, but math compels me to put 9.

PSA: There are two versions of episode 10, they are the same except one has color and other is sepia. I recommend watching the colored version. 
I felt second season stayed true to the themes and ideas from first season, while expanding upon them and examining some new ones. Plot logic around the time of ending could potentially be annoying, but I figured it's something that can be taken symbolically, and in that case it works as an artistic expression. There is some non chronological storytelling, and even though it's confusing, it's confusing in a cool Inception kinda way. 
The emotional impact even goes beyondthe first season, though it's a bit different, as expected. The writing, at least to me, seems to be so good that until the very end I couldn't really predict in which way the story would go. It's one of my favourite things about this title, other being those couple of particularly artistic scenes, as well as visuals and music and their direction. Did I just say that pretty much everything was my favourite thing about this? Yeah, I guess that's one way of putting it.
